name: credential_id
description: Unique identifier (UUID) for this cloud credential record. Used as primary key for credential management operations (rotation, updates, deletion). Each stored credential gets a unique ID for lifecycle tracking.

name: provider
description: Cloud provider identifier. Valid values: 'gcp' (Google Cloud Platform), 'aws' (Amazon Web Services), 'azure' (Microsoft Azure), 'openai', 'anthropic', etc. Used for routing authentication to the correct provider SDK and validation logic.

name: credential_type
description: Type of credential being stored. Examples: 'service_account_key' (GCP JSON key), 'access_key' (AWS access/secret key pair), 'api_key' (API tokens), 'oauth_token', 'connection_string'. Used to determine decryption and usage logic for different authentication methods.

name: encrypted_value
description: AES-256 encrypted credential data stored as binary bytes. Contains the actual sensitive credential (service account JSON, API key, access tokens, etc.) encrypted using Cloud KMS or application-level encryption. Never store credentials in plaintext. Decrypted only when needed for API calls.

name: created_at
description: UTC timestamp when this credential was first stored. Used for audit trails, credential rotation policies, and identifying old credentials that should be rotated. Immutable after creation.

name: updated_at
description: UTC timestamp when this credential was last updated (rotation, re-encryption, metadata changes). Initially same as created_at. Updated on each modification. Used for tracking credential freshness and rotation compliance.

name: is_active
description: Whether this credential is currently active and should be used for authentication. FALSE means credential is disabled/revoked. Used for immediate credential disabling without deletion (maintains audit trail). Can be toggled for emergency credential rotation or temporary access suspension. Default: TRUE for new credentials.
